definition:
Let $(X_n)_{n\ge 0}$ be a Markov Chain. Then the *hitting time* for a
subset $A$ of $I$ (the indexing set) is the random variable:
$$H^A = \inf \{n\ge 0 : X_n\in A\}$$ (set $\inf \varnothing = \infty$).

This can be thought of as the time before the chain is first in a state
that is a member of $A$.

Wite $h_i^A$ for the probability that, starting from $i\in I$ the chain
ever hits the set A: $$h_i^A = P(H^A <\infty : X_0 = i)$$ When A is a
closed class, $h_i^A$ is the *absorption probability*.
